snippet: The peacock mantis shrimp uses its clubs to rain quick, powerful blows on its prey, with little damage to itself because of the claws’ complex three-layer structure.
abstract: Study by Dr David Kisailus published in journal Science describes the composite structure of powerful club appendages that allow mantis shrimp to smash through hard objects such as mollusk shells.
lead_paragraph: The peacock mantis shrimp uses its clubs to rain quick, powerful blows on its prey, with little damage to itself because of the claws’ complex three-layer structure.

headline.print_headline: A Colorful Crustacean With a Knockout Punch
headline.seo: Peacock Mantis Shrimp Has a Knockout Punch
headline.main: A Colorful Crustacean With a Knockout Punch
